Message.Title: Apple’s Latest IPhone Set to Become Best-Selling Gadget
Message.Msg: . Google this, boys: Apple’s Latest IPhone Set to Become Best-Selling Gadget In excerpts. "Apple Inc. (AAPL) unveiled a taller, lighter and speedier iPhone that’s poised to become the fastest selling technology gadget in history -- even as competition accelerates in the $219.1 billion smartphone market. “This is going to be the best-selling consumer electronics device of all time, bar none,” said Carl Howe, an analyst at Boston-based Yankee Group, who predicted that Apple will sell more than 10 million by month’s end, surpassing the record set last year by the predecessor device, the iPhone 4S. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook took the stage in San Francisco yesterday to tout iPhone 5, which runs on faster wireless networks, boasts a bigger screen and has a chip that handles tasks more quickly than past versions. “Apple has never been stronger,” Cook said during the presentation. Apple may sell as many as 58 million units of the iPhone 5 by the end of the year, according the average estimate of analysts surveyed by Bloomberg. That could generate as much as $36.2 billion in sales for Apple, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Going Global Sold with a wireless contract, the iPhone 5 will cost $199, $299 or $399, depending on how much memory it contains. The device will be available for orders on Sept. 14 and lands on store shelves Sept. 21 in the U.S., Australia, Canada, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore and the U.K. It goes on sale in another 22 countries on Sept. 28. The iPhone, introduced in 2007, has helped make Apple the world’s most valuable company. Once a niche computer maker, Apple now generates higher profit than technology competitors Hewlett-Packard Co. (HPQ), Microsoft and Google Inc. (GOOG) Having popularized handheld touch-screen devices that offer swift Web downloads and a range of games, entertainment and productivity tools, Apple is now battling with manufacturers led by Samsung for dominance of a market that leaped 62 percent last year. ‘Radical Revision’ The new iPhone, Apple’s sixth, works with so-called long- term evolution, or LTE, data networks being introduced by companies including AT&T Inc. (T) and Verizon Wireless. LTE is designed to enable quicker Web browsing as well as faster download speeds for video and music than existing networks. Even though using faster networks can drain a phone’s power supply, Apple said iPhone 5’s battery lasts longer than earlier models.The iPhone 5 also comes 18 percent thinner and 20 percent lighter than the iPhone 4S, Apple said. To make the device more svelte, Apple changed the design of the charging-dock connector. To accommodate the slew of accessories that are available for the older dock design, Apple said it will sell an adapter. “The iPhone 5 represents the most radical revision yet to the biggest-selling smartphone,” Mike Gikas, an editor at Consumer Reports, said in an initial review of the product. “It has enough improvements and enhancements that even satisfied owners of the last-generation iPhone 4S will want to consider upgrading.” ‘Blowout, Home Run’ “There’s more attention than ever on Apple,” Schiller told reporters after the event. “That’s a great thing.” “They have built a juggernaut,” said Matt Murphy, a partner at Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, a venture capital firm that invests in iPhone application companies. “This is going to be an absolutely blowout, home-run product.” Apple also enhanced the speech-command service Siri, adding features that let users search for sports scores and make dinner reservations by speaking to the smartphone. A new application called Passbook gives users one application to store their loyalty gift cards, as well as digital tickets to movies, concerts and sporting events. “When you look at each of these, they are incredible, industry-leading innovations by themselves, but what sets them apart and puts Apple way ahead of the competition is how they work so well together,” said Cook." .

Message.Title: NVDA downgrade
Message.Msg: Chips Chopped: Citi Cuts Ratings On Intel, AMD, Nvidia Citing the ongoing weakness in PC demand, Citigroup analyst Glen Yeung this morning cut his ratings on Intel, Advanced Micro Devices and Nvidia to Neutral from Buy. “While these names are down noticeably in recent days, prompted by a noticeably weak August and punctuated by Intel’s recent pre-announcement our downgrade today reflects our checks in Asia that stoke our concerns that the intermediate term prospects for PC’s do not look optimistic,” he writes. “Robbed of catalysts, we see limited likelihood PC-related shares will appreciate meaningfully in coming months, despite valuations.” For 2013, he now sees PC units shrinking 1% – his old forecast was for 4% growth – despite the upcoming launch of Microsoft Windows 8. Here’s Yeung list of reasons for the more bearish view: Yeung asserts that touch-based solutions will comprise less than 5% of production in the 2012 second half, “negating the benefits of the Metro UI.” He says ASP’s of touch-enabled solutions “are apt to remain high, adding $50-$100 to system costs. He also notes that high license fees for Windows RT-based solutions – which are required to bundle Office – are likely to elevate ARM-based notebook prices. “Macro uncertainty is clouding demand and likely limits tolerance for high ASP devices.” Tablet cannibalization also will be an ongoing issue. “After an initial build recovery in September and October, we suspect PC-related builds will again soften from November onward,” he writes. In addition to the downgrades, he also cut his price targets and EPS estimates for the PC chip stocks: Intel: New target is $25.75, down from $32. For 2012, he now sees profits of $2.07 share, down from $2.25. AMD: New target $4.25, down from $6.50. For 2012, Yeung now expects a loss of 72 cents a share; his previous forecast was a loss of 65 cents. Nvidia: Target goes to $15.25, from $16.50. For 2012, Citi now sees profits of 89 cents a share, down from 92 cents. Marvell: Yeung maintains his Neutral rating on the stock, while cutting his target to $11.50, from $14. His EPS estimate for the company are unchanged.

Message.Title: AT&T HTC One X+ 4G LTE with Tegra 3 spotted at FCC
Message.Msg: Source: Android Community Rumors of an HTC One X+ have been floating around for some time now, some even stating a model arriving for T-Mobile. Today however a new and improved Tegra 3 powered quad-core 4G LTE One X+ has hit the FCC en route to AT&T. NVIDIA’s Icera modem recently was approved for AT&T 4G LTE too, so this makes perfect sense. We still aren’t fully sure what to expect from the folks at HTC but they have an event coming up next week where we’ll be learning about what they’ve been brewing. These recent FCC filings have all but confirmed the device exists, and rumors have suggested it will be designed very similar if not the same as the previous One X. I’m hopeful for a larger battery though myself. We’ve seen reports that the NVIDIA Tegra 3 has been boosted to 1.6 GHz on all four cores, as well as 1.7 GHz for the fifth “ninja core” that does the simpler tasks at hand to preserve battery life. The folks from Engadget uncovered this FCC filing earlier today so now we just need to wait for HTC to make a formal announcement. NVIDIA has stated their quad-core Tegra 3+ with 4G LTE radios would make it to market before the end of 2012, and they look to be right on track. Hopefully HTC is aiming for an October launch — which also lines up with a few recent rumors although nothing can be confirmed at this moment. For now it appears that an improved HTC One X+ is for sure headed to AT&T, and possibly to the folks at T-Mobile too. Stay tuned for details from next weeks event.

Topic.Title: Is there room in Apple's lineup for an ipad Mini? - a lot less likely than a couple of days ago

Message.Msg: I don't know if I'd agree the iPad Mini would be better than the Google Nexus 7. No doubt, it would be better then the Fire, but I think the Fire will prove to be a bust, maybe even short-term. And based on what I've read and heard about the iPhone 5, it seems like Apple is starting to lose an edge or maybe it's just not possible to innovate anymore than they have without getting lawsuits for copyright infringement themselves. I mean couldn't the decision about a 4" screen be because there are already the larger 4.3" screens by Samsung out there . . seriously!

Topic.Title: Is there room in Apple's lineup for an ipad Mini? - a lot less likely than a couple of days ago

Message.Msg: As long as Apple maintain its tablet market share it does not want to release iPad mini. There is not going to be a competition between iPad mini and Nexus 7. But there is definitely going to be a competition between iPad mini and New iPad and it is going to hurt the latter big time and will reduce overall pad profit. Why would Apple want to do that?

Topic.Title: Apple added $14 today or over $13 BILLION in market cap which is more than you know who is worth.

Message.Msg: . "Look as us now", crows Jen and his pumper crew. nvidia closed up $00.09 today. Which, times 619,480,000 nvidia shares outstanding, created Fifty Five Million ($55,753,000) of new market cap. Today. "Look as us now", crows Jen and his pumper crew. And it sounds pretty good, right boys? $55,753,000 of new market cap created today. Hooray for the green team, right? Until you compare it to a Good company -- like Apple. Apple closed Up $13.19 per share today -- on news of the phenomenal new iPhone 5. Which, times 937,410,000 aapl shares outstanding, equals Twelve Billion Dollars ($12,308,683,000.00) of new market cap. Created between the Opening bell and the Closing bell. Just today. $12,308,683,000 of new market cap created today by Apple #$%$753,000 of new market cap for nvda. Apple outperformed nvidia by 219.8 Times today, in the Value Creation Department. 219.8X, boys. In just one day. Truly iAwesome, right boys?. So, you ask, what would nvidia's stock price have needed to be today to match Apple's iAwesome increase in market cap? Well, $12,308,683,000.00 of new market cap created by Apple today, divided by 619,480,000 nvidia shares outstanding equals $19.87. Plus the nvda closing price of $13.67 means that to replicate what Apple did today in the Value Creation Department, nvidia stock price at the close would have needed to be $33.53. $33.53 Did your precious nvidia close anywhere in the neighborhood of $33.53? Hummm? Speak up now, boys. You're mumbling at your shoes again. Maybe you boys can pick a better stock next time. One that creates iAwesome Value for its fortunate shareholders. .

Topic.Title: Apple added $14 today or over $13 BILLION in market cap which is more than you know who is worth.

Message.Msg: . $12,308,683,000 of new market cap created today by Apple $55,753,000 of new market cap for nvda. Juuuuuuust a bit of a difference, right boys? .
